lead_paragraph: About 90% of the 2010 compensation is long-term equity awards that align our executives’ interests with those of our stockholders.  The majority of  2010 compensation is one-time equity grants related to the previously announced long-term extensions of employment agreements, which vest over the life of those agreements.   In 2010 Viacom achieved outstanding operational and financial results, including double-digit growth in operating income, adjusted net earnings and total shareholder return.  Viacom shares appreciated 33% during calendar year 2010, versus the S&P 500 gain of 12%.
